title: Create pre-scripted dialogue scenarios
description:
Define the legal document generation dialogue scenarios demonstrating different question types and interactions.

Domain: Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) Generation
Participants: Attorney (user) and Legal Document System (agent)

Detailed Scenario Planning:

=== SCENARIO 1: NDA Document Generation (5-6 turns) ===

Turn 1: Task Initiation
- Attorney: "I need to draft an NDA"
- Move Type: request
- System Response: Task accommodation
  - Infers plan: findout(parties, nda_type, effective_date, duration, governing_law)
  - Pushes first question on QUD
- Expected DialogueMove: Request with intent=draft_document
- QUD State: [?x.parties]

Turn 2: WhQuestion - Parties
- System: "I'll help you draft an NDA. What are the names of the parties entering into this agreement?"
- Move Type: ask (WhQuestion)
- Attorney: "Between Acme Corporation as disclosing party and TechStart Incorporated"
- Entity Extraction: 
  - "Acme Corporation" (ORG, role=disclosing_party)
  - "TechStart Incorporated" (ORG, role=receiving_party)
- Expected DialogueMove: Answer resolving ?x.parties
- QUD State: [] → [?x.nda_type]

Turn 3: AltQuestion - NDA Type
- System: "Should this be a mutual NDA or one-way?"
- Move Type: ask (AltQuestion with alternatives: mutual, one_way)
- Attorney: "Mutual NDA"
- Expected DialogueMove: Answer selecting alternative
- QUD State: [] → [?x.effective_date]

Turn 4: WhQuestion - Effective Date
- System: "What should the effective date be?"
- Move Type: ask (WhQuestion)
- Attorney: "January 1st, 2025"
- Temporal Entity Extraction: "January 1st, 2025" → date(2025-01-01)
- Expected DialogueMove: Answer resolving ?x.effective_date
- QUD State: [] → [?x.duration]

Turn 5: WhQuestion - Duration with Clarification
- System: "What should the confidentiality period be?"
- Move Type: ask (WhQuestion)
- Attorney: "Three years"
- Temporal Duration Extraction: "Three years" → duration(3, years)
- Expected DialogueMove: Answer resolving ?x.duration
- QUD State: [] → [?x.governing_law]

Turn 6: AltQuestion - Governing Law
- System: "Which state law should govern this agreement - California or Delaware?"
- Move Type: ask (AltQuestion with alternatives: California, Delaware)
- Attorney: "California law"
- Entity Extraction: "California" (LOCATION, context=governing_law)
- Expected DialogueMove: Answer selecting alternative
- QUD State: []

Turn 7: Confirmation
- System: "I have all the information needed. Should I generate the NDA now?"
- Move Type: ask (YNQuestion)
- Attorney: "Yes, generate it"
- Expected DialogueMove: Answer (affirmative)
- Action: System shows gathered information summary

=== INFORMATION GATHERED ===
Document Type: Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA)
NDA Type: Mutual
Parties:
  - Disclosing Party: Acme Corporation
  - Receiving Party: TechStart Incorporated
Effective Date: January 1, 2025
Duration: 3 years
Governing Law: California

=== IBDM CONCEPTS DEMONSTRATED ===

1. Task Accommodation:
   - Attorney's initial request triggers plan inference
   - System constructs findout plan with sub-questions

2. Question Types:
   - WhQuestion: parties, effective_date, duration (open-ended)
   - AltQuestion: nda_type, governing_law (constrained choices)
   - YNQuestion: final confirmation

3. QUD Stack Evolution:
   - Questions pushed in order based on plan
   - Questions popped as answers received
   - Stack empty when all information gathered

4. Entity Tracking:
   - Organizations: Acme Corporation, TechStart Incorporated
   - Temporal: January 1, 2025, 3 years
   - Location: California
   - Entities tracked across turns with roles/attributes

5. Information State:
   - Private IS (Agent): Document template, validation rules, plan
   - Shared IS: Gathered document parameters, QUD stack, commitments
   - Control IS: Turn-taking, dialogue phase

6. Accommodation Mechanisms:
   - Task accommodation: Inferring document requirements from request
   - Answer accommodation: Understanding entity roles from context
   - Question accommodation: Clarifying ambiguous references

=== DATA STRUCTURE ===

title: Phase 2.5: Burr-Centric State Refactoring
description: Refactor dialogue engine to move all state under Burr management. Transform engine from stateful to stateless, making Burr the single source of truth for all dialogue state including InformationState, NLU context, and entity tracking.

title: Phase 1: Extract InformationState from engine to Burr State
description: Move InformationState from DialogueMoveEngine.state to Burr State. Update initialize action to create InformationState and write to Burr State. Remove self.state from DialogueMoveEngine.__init__. This is the foundation for making engine stateless.

title: Phase 1: Update initialize action to create InformationState in Burr
description: Modify the initialize action to create initial InformationState and write it to Burr State under 'information_state' key. Engine should remain in Burr State but without internal state.

title: Phase 2: Convert interpret() to accept and return state
description: Refactor DialogueMoveEngine.interpret() to accept InformationState as parameter instead of using self.state. Method should be pure: interpret(utterance, speaker, state) -> list[DialogueMove]. Update all callers.

title: Phase 2: Convert integrate() to pure function
description: Refactor integrate() to accept state parameter and return new InformationState. Signature: integrate(move, state) -> InformationState. Should not mutate self.state. Ensure immutability.

title: Phase 2: Convert select_action() to accept state parameter
description: Refactor select_action() to accept InformationState: select_action(state) -> DialogueMove | None. Remove dependency on self.state. Agenda operations should work on passed state.

title: Phase 2: Convert generate() to accept state parameter
description: Refactor generate() to accept InformationState: generate(move, state) -> str. Remove self.state dependency. Generation rules should use passed state for context.

title: Phase 2: Remove self.state completely from DialogueMoveEngine
description: Final cleanup of Phase 2: remove self.state field from DialogueMoveEngine. Remove reset() method or refactor to work with state parameters. Verify no remaining stateful references.

title: Phase 3: Update interpret action to read/write InformationState
description: Modify interpret Burr action to read 'information_state' from Burr State and pass to engine.interpret(). Action signature: reads=['utterance', 'speaker', 'information_state', 'engine'], writes=['moves'].

title: Phase 3: Update integrate action to read/write InformationState
description: Modify integrate action to read 'information_state', pass to engine.integrate(), and write updated state back. Signature: reads=['moves', 'information_state', 'engine'], writes=['information_state', 'integrated'].

title: Phase 3: Update select action to read InformationState
description: Modify select action to read 'information_state' and pass to engine.select_action(). Signature: reads=['information_state', 'engine'], writes=['response_move', 'has_response'].

title: Phase 3: Update generate action to read/write InformationState
description: Modify generate action to read 'information_state', pass to engine.generate(), and integrate response move by writing updated state. Signature: reads=['response_move', 'information_state', 'engine'], writes=['utterance_text', 'information_state'].

title: Phase 3: Update DialogueStateMachine wrapper to expose InformationState
description: Update DialogueStateMachine.get_information_state() to return state['information_state'] from Burr State instead of engine.state. Add helper methods for state inspection.

title: Phase 4: Create NLUContext dataclass for NLU state
description: Design and implement NLUContext dataclass to hold entity tracking, reference chains, and interpretation metrics. Should be serializable for Burr State. Fields: entities, entity_mentions, reference_chains, last_interpretation_tokens, last_interpretation_latency.

title: Phase 4: Refactor EntityTracker to work with NLUContext
description: Modify EntityTracker to accept and return NLUContext instead of maintaining internal state. Methods should be: extract(utterance, context) -> NLUContext, get_entities(context) -> list[Entity].

title: Phase 4: Refactor ReferenceResolver to use NLUContext
description: Update ReferenceResolver to accept NLUContext for entity lookup. Methods should accept context parameter: resolve(reference, context, state) -> Entity | None.

title: Phase 4: Update NLUDialogueEngine to use NLUContext from Burr
description: Refactor NLUDialogueEngine to read 'nlu_context' from Burr State instead of maintaining internal entity tracker. Update _interpret_with_nlu() to accept and return NLUContext.

title: Phase 4: Add nlu_context to Burr State schema
description: Update create_dialogue_application() to initialize nlu_context in Burr State when using NLUDialogueEngine. Update actions to read/write nlu_context as needed.

title: Phase 5: Remove hybrid fallback strategy
description: Per user guidance: remove HybridFallbackStrategy, FallbackConfig, and all fallback-related code. Assume resources are available. Simplify to use single model (Sonnet 4.5 for complex, Haiku 4.5 for quick tasks).

title: Phase 5: Simplify NLUEngineConfig
description: Remove fallback-related config options. Simplify to: model (Sonnet/Haiku), temperature, max_tokens. Assume IBDM_API_KEY is always available. Remove use_nlu, use_llm, fallback_to_rules flags.

title: Phase 5: Remove conditional NLU initialization
description: Remove try/except and conditional logic around NLU component initialization. Assume components always succeed. Remove error handling for missing API keys.

title: Update all unit tests for stateless engine
description: Refactor all engine tests to pass InformationState explicitly. Update test fixtures. Add property tests to verify methods are pure (no side effects).

title: Update all integration tests for Burr state schema
description: Update Burr integration tests to verify information_state is in Burr State. Test state persistence and retrieval. Verify complete state capture.

title: Add state schema validation
description: Implement validation for Burr State schema. Ensure information_state, nlu_context (if applicable), and engine are present. Add validation tests.

title: Update documentation for stateless architecture
description: Update all documentation to reflect stateless engine design. Update docstrings for all refactored methods. Add examples showing state passing. Update architecture diagrams.

title: Create migration guide for users
description: Write guide for migrating from stateful to stateless engine. Include code examples, migration checklist, common pitfalls. Document backward compatibility period.
